result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew James Berres was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew James Berres is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew James Berres was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Report to Probation today January 12, 2015 by 2:00 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Matthew James Berres appeared.  Court called at 10:34 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Includes case 14CF75, 14CF76 & 14CM64.  DE files Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Court reads charges and maximum penalties.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1  in 14CF75.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF75. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF75.  14CF76 and 14CM64 dismissed but read in for purposes of restitution. Victim rights have been complied with.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 3 years probation with conditions
- 3 months conditional jail time in the St. Croix County Jail
- DE can serve his jail time in Eau Claire County if at no expense to St. Croix County 
- Court grants huber for work
- Court orders Victim Empathy Seminar
- $1,183.61 joint and several restitution to Timothy Stevenson to be paid through DOC
- $206.00 joint and several restitution to Jonathan Becker to be paid through the DOC
- $630.00 joint and several restitution to Vicki Datt to be paid through the DOC
- Court costs and DNA surcharge of $518.00 to be paid through the DOC
- Report to jail by 2:00 p.m. today 01/12/15
- Report to Eau Claire County to serve no later than 03/06/15
- 20 days to appeal
